member.name: T:OneTrueError.Client.Config.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Main configuration objects. Assessible through the property.

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Client.Config.OneTrueConfiguration
member.summary: Configuration root object.

member.name: F:OneTrueError.Client.Config.OneTrueConfiguration._userInteraction
member.summary: Configure how the reporting UI will interact with the user.

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Client.Config.OneTrueConfiguration.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of .

member.name: P:OneTrueError.Client.Config.OneTrueConfiguration.ContextProviders
member.summary: Used to add custom context info providers.

member.name: P:OneTrueError.Client.Config.OneTrueConfiguration.FilterCollection
member.summary: Used to decide which reports can be uploaded (for instance to sample reports in high volume systems).

member.name: P:OneTrueError.Client.Config.OneTrueConfiguration.MaxNumberOfPropertiesPerCollection
member.summary: Limit the amount of properties that can be collected per context collection.

remarks.para: Some collections can contain thousands of properties when building collections by reflecting objects. Those will take time to process and analyze by the server when a lot of reports are uploaded for the same incident. To limit that you can specify a property limit wich will make the stop after a certain amount of properties (when invoked from within the library).

member.name: P:OneTrueError.Client.Config.OneTrueConfiguration.QueueReports
member.summary: Queue reports and upload them in the background.

remarks.para: This option is great if you do not want to freeze the UI while reports are being uploaded. They are queued in an internal queue until being uploaded in orderly fashion.

member.name: P:OneTrueError.Client.Config.OneTrueConfiguration.ThrowExceptions
member.summary: The library may throw exceptions if the server cannot be contacted / accept the upload.

remarks.para: Default is true, turn of before going to production.
You can use the event to get aware of errors when this flag is set to true.

member.name: P:OneTrueError.Client.Config.OneTrueConfiguration.Uploaders
member.summary: The objects used to upload reports to the OneTrueError service.

member.name: P:OneTrueError.Client.Config.OneTrueConfiguration.UserInteraction
member.summary: Configure how the reporting UI will interact with the user.

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Client.Config.OneTrueConfiguration.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Client.Config.OneTrueConfiguration.Credentials(System.Uri,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Configure uploads
member.param: Host. Host and absolute path to the onetrueerror directory
Shared secret from the web site

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Client.Config.OneTrueConfiguration.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose pattern.

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Client.Config.UserInteractionConfiguration

member.name: P:OneTrueError.Client.Config.UserInteractionConfiguration.AskUserForDetails
member.summary: Display a dialog for the user where he/she can enter information about what he/she did when the exception was thrown.

member.name: P:OneTrueError.Client.Config.UserInteractionConfiguration.AskUserForPermission
member.summary: Ask the user if we may upload the error report.

member.summary: Goes through the exception and maps all custom properties. Will be added into a collection called ExceptionProperties.

member.summary: Returns "ExceptionProperties"

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Client.ContextProviders.ExceptionPropertiesProvider.Collect(OneTrueError.Client.Reporters.IErrorReporterContext)
member.summary: Collect information
member.param: Context information provided by the class which reported the error.
member.returns: Collection. Items with multiple values are joined using ";;"

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Client.ContextProviders.AppInfoProvider
member.summary: Collects information about the currently running application.

remarks.para: The collection is named ApplicationInfo and the collected information is:

item.description: Amount of OS handles that your application have opened.
Total amount used by your process (including OS time like reading from files or sending stuff over a socket).
Amount of time used to execute your code.
Executable used to start the process, including the module name, file name, and module memory details.
Executable file name, without path and file extension.
number of bytes of physical memory mapped to the process context.
Current size of virtual memory used by the process.
Current size of memory used by the process that cannot be shared with other processes (i.e. dedicated memory).
Starting priority for threads created within the associated process.

member.name: F:OneTrueError.Client.ContextProviders.AppInfoProvider.NameConstant
member.summary: Name of the context collection

member.summary: Collect information
member.param: Context information provided by the class which reported the error.
member.returns: Collection. Items with multiple values are joined using ";;"

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Client.Contracts.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The DTO's used to submit information to OneTrueError.

remarks.para: Everything is serialized to JSON and then DTO is then compressed using ZIP before being uploaded to OneTrueError. The body is signed using HMAC and the signature is provided as sig in the query string.

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Client.Converters.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Serializers and converters.

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Client.Converters.ObjectToContextCollectionConverter
member.summary: Converts an object into a context collection.

remarks.para: The following conversions are supported:

item.description: Collection will be named CustomData. All properties will be included
Collection will be named as the class. All properties will be included
All collections will be added as different ones (and not nested)

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Client.Converters.ObjectToContextCollectionConverter.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of .

member.name: P:OneTrueError.Client.Converters.ObjectToContextCollectionConverter.MaxPropertyCount
member.summary: Maximum number of properties that can be added during the collection process.

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Client.Converters.ObjectToContextCollectionConverter.Convert(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Turn an object into a string which can be used for debugging.
member.param: Name of the collection that is being created. This name is displayed under "Similarities" and "Context info" in our UI.
Object to get a string representation for
member.returns: "null" if the object is null, otherwise an string as given per object sample
member.remarks: Look at the class doc for an example.

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Client.Converters.ObjectToContextCollectionConverter.Convert(System.Object)
member.summary: Turn an object into a string which can be used for debugging.
member.param: Object to get a string representation for
member.returns: "null" if the object is null, otherwise an string as given per object sample

remarks.para: Collection name will be ContextData unless the object is a real type which is not a collection (in that case the type name is used).
Look at the class doc for an example.

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Client.Converters.ObjectToContextCollectionConverter.Ignore(System.String[])
member.summary: Properties that should be ignored when the context collection is being built.

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Client.Converters.ObjectToContextCollectionConverter.IsSimpleType(System.Type)
member.summary: Checks if the specified type could be traversed or just added as a value.
member.returns: true if we should add this type as a value; false if we should do reflection on it.

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Client.Converters.ObjectToContextCollectionConverter.ReflectObject(System.Object,System.String,OneTrueError.Client.Contracts.ContextCollectionDTO,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Object})
member.summary: Use reflection on a complex object to add it's values to our context collection
member.param: Collection that values should be added to.

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Client.Converters.ObjectToContextCollectionConverter.ReflectValue(System.String,System.Object,OneTrueError.Client.Contracts.ContextCollectionDTO,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Object})
member.summary: Use reflection on a complex object to add it's values to our context collection.
member.param: Property that this collection belongs to
Collection that values should be added to.

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Client.Converters.IncludeNonPublicMembersContractResolver
member.summary: JSON.NET class which also includes all private fields.

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Client.ObjectExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for objects.

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Client.ObjectExtensions.IsAnonymousType(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether the given type is an anonymous object.
member.returns: true if type is anonymous; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Client.ObjectExtensions.ToContextCollection(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts simple objects into context collections
member.remarks: Anonymous types get the collection name "CustomData" while any other class get the class name as collection name.

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Client.ObjectExtensions.ToContextCollection(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Converts simple objects into context collections
member.param: Name to assign to the context collection
member.remarks: Anonymous types get the collection name "CustomData" while any other class get the class name as collection name.

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Client.OneTrue
member.summary: Main mother of all true things.

member.name: P:OneTrueError.Client.OneTrue.Configuration
member.summary: Access configuration options

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Client.OneTrue.GenerateReport(System.Exception)
member.summary: Will generate a report without uploading it.
member.param: Exception that you want to get reported
member.returns: Unique identifier for this report (generated using )

remarks.para: All library exceptions are directed to the OneTrue.ReportingFailed event. Subscribe on that event if you have trouble with reporting exceptions.

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Client.OneTrue.GenerateReport(System.Exception,System.Object)
member.summary: Will generate a report without uploading it.
member.param: Exception that you want to get reported
Context specific information which would make it easier to reproduce and correct the exception. See to understand what kind of information you can attach.
member.returns: Unique identifier for this report (generated using )

remarks.para: All library exceptions are directed to the OneTrue.ReportingFailed event. Subscribe on that event if you have trouble with reporting exceptions.

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Client.OneTrue.GenerateReport(OneTrueError.Client.Reporters.IErrorReporterContext)
member.summary: Generate an error report

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Client.OneTrue.LeaveFeedback(System.String,OneTrueError.Client.ContextCollections.UserSuppliedInformation)
member.summary: A user have written information about what he/she did when the exception was thrown; or the user want to get information about the bug fixing progress (i.e. want to know when the error is corrected).
member.param: Id generated by this library. Returned when you invoke .

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Client.OneTrue.Report(System.Exception)
member.summary: Report an exception directly.
member.param: Exception that you want to get reported
member.returns: Unique identifier for this report (generated using )

remarks.para: All library exceptions are directed to the OneTrue.ReportingFailed event. Subscribe on that event if you have trouble with reporting exceptions.

Context specific information which would make it easier to reproduce and correct the exception. See to understand what kind of information you can attach.
member.returns: Unique identifier for this report (generated using )

remarks.para: Context information will be collected and included in the error report. You can configure the attached information by using OneTrue.Configuration.ContextProviders
All library exceptions are directed to the OneTrue.ReportingFailed event. Subscribe on that event if you have trouble with reporting exceptions.

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Client.Processor.ReportIdGenerator
member.summary: Used to be able to choose reportId id strategy

remarks.para: The reportId id is the string which are used during communication between the end customers and the OneTrue error customers.
The default implementation Base64 encodes a guid (the last "--" is removed from the Base64 string,"/" is replaced with "_" and "+" is replaced with "-".
The ID must be globally unique (or at least within your own application scope).

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Client.Uploaders.IReportUploader
member.summary: Defines the contract for all classes that will send the error report to a specific destination.

remarks.para: This contract gives a best effort promsie. i.e. it only promises to deliver the DTOs as soon as possible, but reports might be trashed if retried a certain amount of times or during a certain period of time. The UploadFailed event MUST be invoked by implementations when DTOs are thrown away.

member.name: E:OneTrueError.Client.Uploaders.IReportUploader.UploadFailed
member.summary: Have given up the attempt to deliver a report.
member.remarks: The reason is implementation specific but is typically configured using a set of properties.

member.summary: Send feedback for a previously submitted error report

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Client.Uploaders.IReportUploader.UploadReport(OneTrueError.Client.Contracts.ErrorReportDTO)
member.summary: Upload report
member.param: Error report that should be uploaded to the service

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Client.Uploaders.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Submitters are the classes which takes error reports and delivers them to a specific destination. The destination itself can be anything from an local log file to a web service.

remarks.para: The OneTrueError reporter is defined as .

This library will enqueue every error report for each submitter and also persist the queue. It that way the library can continue to upload error reports to every submitter even if the application crashes.

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Client.Uploaders.UploadToOneTrueError
member.summary: Upload reports to our web site.

remarks.para: To use this reporter you have to create an account at http://onetrueerror.com and then register an application to get an application key and a shared secret.
Finally use that information to configure this reporter:

Reports will be queued internally if there are no internet connection available. The queue have the same constrains as in the global configuration. Thus the olders reports will be dropped if the connection is down and the queue limit have been reached.

Nothing in the queue is persisted. Thus if the application are stopped before all reports have been uploaded, they will be lost. This is only a problem if the OneTrueError service is slow or if the internet connection is down.

This uploader will check the internet settings (that are configured in the windows control panel) to see if an internet proxy is required. If it is, the HttpClient will be configured to use it. So this library should work behind corporate firewalls.

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Client.Uploaders.UploadToOneTrueError.#ctor(System.Uri,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Uri to the root of the OneTrueError web. Example. http://yourWebServer/OneTrueError/

summary.para: Welcome to the reporting library for OneTrueError. Read below the class list for more information about the library.
This library is configured by using the class. A minimal setup contains a single line:

The appKey/sharedSecret can be found in our web once you have created an account: http://onetrueerror.com. The above line will not detect any exceptions automatically, you have to report each exception by yourself:
You can also include own context information by specifying a second argument:
You can read more about reporting in the documentation.

If you are interested in providing your own context information automatically you should start by reading the namespace and then add your own provider by using OneTrue.Configuration.ContextProviders.Add().
